content.title: Vidyakiranam Scheme-Educational Assistance To Children Of Disabled Parents
content.department: Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala
content.details: The scheme 'Vidyakiranam Scheme-Educational Assistance to Children of Disabled Parents' was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala. The government of Kerala has initiated this scheme which provides educational assistance to children of differently abled parents (disability for both parents/ disability for anyone parent) who are economically deprived. Under the scheme, educational assistance will be provided to 25 children from each district for a duration of 10 months.
benefits: ₹300/- per month for 10 months for Standard 1 to 5
₹500/- per month for 10 months for Standard 6 to 10
₹750/- per month for 10 months for +1, +2, ITI equivalent courses
₹1000/- per month for 10 months for Degree, Post-Graduation, Polytechnic, Equivalent Courses, Training Courses, Professional Courses
eligibility: The applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala.
The children of differently abled parents belonging to the BPL category (Both / Anyone) will get a scholarship under this scheme.
The applicant should be a student.
The disability of the applicant’s father/ mother must be 40% or above.
The students pursuing courses from Govt. approved institutions are eligible to apply under this scheme.
exclusions: The students pursuing courses from parallel colleges and doing part-time courses are not eligible to apply under the scheme.
The students benefiting from other educational assistance schemes are not eligible to apply under this scheme.
content.application_process: Online and Offline. To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant needs to visit SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
documents_required: Attested copy of Disability ID card of parents.
Income Certificate for proof of income
Copy of Medical board certificate showing the percentage of disability
Bank details- Copy of Pass Book

faqs.question: What is the 'Vidyakiranam Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The government of Kerala has initiated the scheme to provide educational assistance to children of differently abled parents (disability for both parents/disability for anyone parent) who are economically deprived.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Social Justice Department, Government of Kerala.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The children of differently abled parents belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category (Both /Anyone) are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What should be the disability percentage of the parents?
faqs.answer: The disability of the applicant’s father/ mother should be 40% or above.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a resident of Kerala State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should be a permanent resident of Kerala State.

faqs.question: Should the students pursue their courses from government-approved institutions?
faqs.answer: Yes, the students pursuing courses from Govt. approved institutions are eligible to apply under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the scholarship will be given to the children of differently abled parents who are studying in Class 1st to Post-Graduation.

faqs.question: For how many months will the scholarship be given in an academic year?
faqs.answer: The scholarship will be provided to all classes for a duration of 10 months.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for BPL Category?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicants should belong to BPL Category.

faqs.question: How will the eligible students receive the scholarship amount?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount will be transferred to the bank account of the eligible students.

faqs.question: How many students will be given scholarships in a district of Kerala under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, the scholarship will be provided to 25 students in each district of Kerala.

faqs.question: How can an applicant apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: To avail of the benefits of the scheme, the applicant should visit the Official Portal- SUNEETHI- Online Service Application Portal.
